name: Senior Engineer
goals: Transform my team of 5 juniors to an AI-first approach
Become a principal engineer within 18 months
Master AI tools and teach them company-wide
Build world-class code review and quality practices
Make strategic tech debt and prioritization decisions
Create a culture of continuous learning

team_experience: Alex - Junior (1 year exp) - enthusiastic but overconfident with AI
Priya - Junior (1 year exp) - cautious, resistant to AI tools
Jordan - Junior (0.5 years exp) - eager but easily overwhelmed
Sam - Mid-level (3 years exp) - strong fundamentals, promotion candidate
Taylor - Mid-level (2.5 years exp) - solid performer, imposter syndrome
team_challenges: Uneven AI adoption (some love it, some avoid it)
Code quality varies significantly between team members
Tech debt accumulating faster than we can address it
Knowledge silos forming around certain systems
Difficulty scaling team culture as we grow

works_with: Design team (Alex leads) - wants pixel-perfect implementations
Security team (Sam leads) - concerned about AI-generated code
common_challenges: Balancing feature requests with tech debt
Explaining technical complexity to non-technical stakeholders
Getting buy-in for AI tools and practices
Managing expectations when things go wrong

current_challenges: AI adoption resistance from some team members
Tech debt in core systems slowing velocity 40%
Recent production bug from AI-generated code hurt trust
Junior developers need more structured mentoring
Stakeholders don't understand why things take time
Team culture fraying as we scale from 3 to 5 people
No clear process for AI code review and quality gates
Balancing my own coding time with leadership responsibilities
strengths: Strong technical fundamentals and architecture knowledge
Care deeply about code quality and best practices
Willing to learn and experiment with new tools
Committed to team growth and success
growth_areas: Mentoring juniors patiently when under pressure
Making quick decisions with incomplete information
Managing my time between coding and leadership

success_stories: Used AI to refactor 5k lines of legacy code successfully
Generated comprehensive test suite that caught 3 bugs
Wrote documentation 3x faster with AI assistance
concerns: AI-generated bug in production damaged team trust
Some team members using AI without understanding code
Security team worried about IP leakage
Uncertainty about when to use vs not use AI

best_times: Early morning (7-9 AM) for focused learning
Lunch break (30-45 min) for quick exercises
Friday afternoons for reflection and planning
motivated_by: Seeing my team succeed and grow
Becoming the leader my team deserves

short_term: Complete AI Tools Mastery module (1 month)
Handle next difficult stakeholder conversation successfully
Implement AI code review process with team
Mentor junior through complete feature (pair programming)
medium_term: Get entire team confidently using AI tools (3 months)
Complete all core training modules (4 months)
Present technical strategy to VP Engineering successfully
long_term: Transform team into high-performing AI-first unit (6 months)
Be recognized as AI champion across organization (9 months)
Get promoted to Principal Engineer (18 months)
Train 2 other senior engineers to lead their own teams (12 months)
